channel.title: spiritbox on Loud Legends
channel.description: Recent content in spiritbox on Loud Legends

item.title: Korn's Original Drummer David Silveria Opens Up on 30th Anniversary
item.description: David Silveria celebrates the 30th anniversary of Korn’s debut album with a nostalgic Instagram post.

item.title: KORN’s Brian 'Head' Welch on Mortality: "I Want to Die in a Bed, Not On Stage"
item.description: Brian “Head” Welch is considering retirement within the next 10 years but insists he won’t fake it if the band starts to sound outdated.

item.title: Watch: Korn Performs "Hey Daddy" Live for First Time Since 1999
item.description: Korn played “Hey Daddy” live for the first time since 1999.

item.title: Korn Kicks Off 2024 Tour with a Nostalgic Setlist in Tampa
item.description: Korn kicked off their North American tour in Tampa, reviving deep cuts like “Hey Daddy” (first time since 1999).

item.title: Korn Invites Fans to Create Art for 30th Anniversary—See How You Can Get Involved
item.description: Korn launches a fan art contest to celebrate 30 years of their legacy.

item.title: Korn's Hits Get a Lo-Fi Makeover—And They Approve
item.description: Korn approved a lo-fi instrumental cover album of their hits by lonelyboy.

item.title: Brian Welch on Korn's New Album: “The Heaviest in Years”
item.description: Korn’s guitarist Brian “Head” Welch claims the band’s upcoming music will be the heaviest they’ve produced in years.

item.title: Korn Announces 30th Anniversary Concert with Star-Studded Lineup
item.description: Korn will celebrate the 30th anniversary of their debut album with a huge show at BMO Stadium in Los Angeles on October 5, 2024.
